intro: Luetzelburgia andrade-limae, commonly known as the Andrade-Limae cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent structure. Its flowers are short-lived but attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. Luetzelburgia andrade-limae is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
